channel.title: Projects on Hugo Cisneros
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Hugo Cisneros

item.title: Stochastic optimization for large scale optimal transport
Graph neural networks for influence maximization
Adversarial examples in reinforcement learning
item.description: Links Project slides Project report Description The goal of this project was to write a review of adversarial examples in RL as of January 2019. It was also made into a talk for which the slides can be found above. This project was a collaboration with Clément Acher, part of a reinforcement learning course taught by Alessandro Lazaric and Matteo Pirotta.

item.title: Style transfer with generative adversarial neural networks
item.description: Links Project slides Project report Description This project’s goal was to implement style transfer techniques based on GANs. We applied several algorithms on our own datasets of landscape pictures scraped from Flickr and frames from anime extracted automatically. This project was a collaboration with Clément Acher and was part of the course Object recognition and computer vision taught by Jean Ponce, Ivan Laptev, Cordelia Schmid and Josef Sivic.

item.title: Arxiv explorer
item.description: Github repo Description This project was about creating a tool similar to Arxiv Sanity with additional NLP functionalities for finding similar papers from their abstract. I used a concept from [1], which uses earth mover’s distance metric between documents represented as normalized bag-of-words. The underlying transport cost between two words is given by their distance in a pre-trained word vector space. The app trains word vectors on all Arxiv abstracts and uses the EMD based metric to compute similarities between papers.
